metadata.titleCn: 黑河生态水文遥感试验：黑河流域中游覆盖度和生物量观测数据集(2014年)
metadata.description:
This data includes the coverage data set of vegetation in one growth cycle in five stations of Daman super station, wetland, desert, desert and Gobi, and the biomass data set of maize and wetland reed in one growth cycle in Daman super station. The observation time starts from May 10, 2014 and ends on September 11, 2014.            
1 coverage observation            
1.1 observation time            
1.1.1 super station: the observation period is from May 10 to September 11, 2014. Before July 20, the observation is once every five days. After July 20, the observation is once every 10 days. A total of 17 observations are made. The specific observation time is as follows:;            
Super stations: May 10, 15, 20, 25, 30, 10, 15, 20, 20, 30, 30, 30, 30, 30, 7, 10, 10, 10, 10, 10, 15            
1.1.2 other four stations: the observation period is from May 20 to September 15, 2014, once every 10 days, and 11 observations have been made in total. The specific observation time is as follows:;            
Other four stations: May 10, 2014, May 20, 2014, May 30, 2014, June 10, 2014, June 20, 2014, June 30, July 10, 2014, July 20, August 5, 2014, August 17, 2014, September 11, 2014            
1.2 observation method            
1.2.1 measuring instruments and principles:            
The digital camera is placed on the instrument platform at the front end of the simple support pole to keep the shooting vertical and downward and remotely control the camera measurement data. The observation frame can be used to change the shooting height of the camera and realize targeted measurement for different types of vegetation.            
1.2.2 design of sample            
Super station: take 3 plots in total, the sample size of each plot is 10 × 10 meters, take photos along two diagonal lines in turn each time, take 9-10 photos in total;            Wetland station: take 2 sample plots, each plot is 10 × 10 meters in size, and take 9-10 photos for each survey;            
3 other stations: select 1 sample plot, each sample plot is 10 × 10 meters in size, and take 9-10 photos for each survey;            
1.2.3 shooting method            
For the super station corn and wetland station reed, the observation frame is directly used to ensure that the camera on the observation frame is far higher than the vegetation crown height. Samples are taken along the diagonal in the square quadrat, and then the arithmetic average is made. In the case of a small field angle (< 30 °), the field of view includes more than 2 ridges with a full cycle, and the side length of the photo is parallel to the ridge; in the other three sites, due to the relatively low vegetation, the camera is directly used to take pictures vertically downward (without using the bracket).            
1.2.4 coverage calculation            
The coverage calculation is completed by Beijing Normal University, and an automatic classification method is adopted. For details, see article 1 of "recommended references". By transforming RGB color space to lab space which is easier to distinguish green vegetation, the histogram of green component A is clustered to separate green vegetation and non green background, and the vegetation coverage of a single photo is obtained. The advantage of this method lies in its simple algorithm, easy to implement and high degree of automation and precision. In the future, more rapid, automatic and accurate classification methods are needed to maximize the advantages of digital camera methods.            
2 biomass observation            
2.1 observation time            
2.1.1 corn: the observation period is from May 10 to September 11, 2014, once every 5 days before July 20, and once every 10 days after July 20. A total of 17 observations have been made. The specific observation time is as follows:;            
Super stations: May 10, 15, 20, 25, 30, 10, 15, 20, 20, 30, 30, 30, 30, 30, 7, 10, 10, 10, 10, 10, 15            
2.1.2 Reed: the observation period is from May 20 to September 15, 2014, once every 10 days, and 11 observations have been made in total. The specific observation time is as follows:;  2014-5-10、2014-5-20、2014-5-30、2014-6-10、2014-6-20、2014-6-30、2014-7-10、2014-7-20、2014-8-5、2014-8-17、2014-9-11            
2.2 observation method            
Corn: select three sample plots, and select three corn plants that represent the average level of each sample plot for each observation, respectively weigh the fresh weight (aboveground biomass + underground biomass) and the corresponding dry weight (85 ℃ constant temperature drying), and calculate the biomass of unit area corn according to the plant spacing and row spacing;            
Reed: set two 0.5m × 0.5m quadrats, cut them in the same place, and weigh the fresh weight (stem and leaf) and dry weight (constant temperature drying at 85 ℃) of reed respectively.            
2.3 observation instruments            
Balance (accuracy 0.01g), oven.            
3 data storage            
All the observation data were recorded in the excel table first, and then stored in the excel table. At the same time, the data of corn planting structure was sorted out, including the plant spacing, row spacing, planting time, irrigation time, except for the parent time, harvesting time and other relevant information.
metadata.descriptionCn:
本数据包括大满超级站、湿地、沙漠、荒漠和戈壁五个站点植被一个生长周期内的覆盖度数据集以及大满超级站玉米和湿地芦苇两种植被一个生长周期内的生物量数据集。观测时间自2014年5月10日开始，9月11日结束。
1覆盖度观测
1.1观测时间
1.1.1超级站：观测时间段2014年5月10日-9月11日， 7月20日以前每5天观测一次，7月20后每10天观测一次，共做了17次观测，具体观测时间如下；
超级站：2014-5-10、2014-5-15、2014-5-20、2014-5-25、2014-5-30、2014-6-10、2014-6-15、2014-6-20、2014-6-25、2014-6-30、2014-7-5、2014-7-10、2014-7-15、2014-7-20、2014-8-5、2014-8-17、2014-9-11
1.1.2其它四个站：观测时间段2014年5月20日-9月15日，每10天观测一次，共做了11次观测，具体观测时间如下；
其它四个站：2014-5-10、2014-5-20、2014-5-30、2014-6-10、2014-6-20、2014-6-30、2014-7-10、2014-7-20、2014-8-5、2014-8-17、2014-9-11
1.2观测方法
1.2.1测量仪器与原理：
采用数码相机拍照的方法测量，将数码相机置于简易支撑杆前端的仪器平台，保持拍摄的竖直向下，远程控制相机测量数据。观测架可以用来改变相机的拍摄高度，面向不同类型植被实现有针对性的测量。
1.2.2样方的设计
超级站：共取3块样地，每块样地样方大小10×10米，每样地每次测量时沿两条对角线依次拍照，共取9-10张照片；
湿地站：共取2块样地，每块样地样方大小10×10米，每样地每次测量拍9-10张照片；
其它3个站：选取1块样地，每块样地样方大小10×10米，每样地每次测量拍9-10张照片；
1.2.3拍摄方法
针对超级站玉米和湿地站芦苇，直接采用观测架观测，保证观测架上的相机距离植被冠层的高度远大于植被冠幅，在方形样方内沿着对角线采样，然后做算术平均。在视场角度不大(<30°)的情况下，视场内包括大于2个整周期的垄行，相片的边长与垄行平行；其它三个站点由于植被比较低矮，直接用相机垂直向下拍照（未使用支架）。
1.2.4 覆盖度计算
覆盖度计算由北京师范大学完成，采用一种自动分类方法，具体见 “建议参考文献”第1条文献。通过RGB颜色空间转换到更容易区分绿色植被的Lab空间，对绿度分量a的直方图进行聚类，分离出绿色植被和非绿色背景2组分，获得单张相片的植被覆盖度。该方法的优点在于其算法简单、易于实现而且自动化程度和精度较高。今后还需要更多的快速、自动、准确的分类方法，最大限度发挥数码相机方法的优势。
2生物量观测
2.1观测时间
2.1.1玉米：观测时间段2014年5月10日-9月11日， 7月20日以前每5天观测一次，7月20后每10天观测一次，共做了17次观测，具体观测时间如下；
超级站：2014-5-10、2014-5-15、2014-5-20、2014-5-25、2014-5-30、2014-6-10、2014-6-15、2014-6-20、2014-6-25、2014-6-30、2014-7-5、2014-7-10、2014-7-15、2014-7-20、2014-8-5、2014-8-17、2014-9-11
2.1.2芦苇：观测时间段2014年5月20日-9月15日，每10天观测一次，共做了11次观测，具体观测时间如下；
2014-5-10、2014-5-20、2014-5-30、2014-6-10、2014-6-20、2014-6-30、2014-7-10、2014-7-20、2014-8-5、2014-8-17、2014-9-11
2.2观测方法
玉米：选取3块样地，每块样地每次观测选取代表样地平均水平的三株玉米分别称每株玉米的鲜重（地上生物量+地下生物量）和相应的干重（85℃恒温烘干），根据种植的株距和行距计算单位面积玉米的生物量；
芦苇：设置2个0.5mÍ0.5m的样方，齐地刈割，分别称取芦苇的鲜重（茎叶）和干重（85℃恒温烘干）。
2.3观测仪器
天平（精度0.01g）、烘箱。
3数据的存储
所有观测数据先手薄记录后整理到Excel表中存储，同时整理了玉米种植结构数据，包括种植的株距、行距，种植时间、灌水时间、除父本时间以及收割时间等相关信息。

background: Upscaling of eco-hydrological processes on a heterogeneous surface is a grand challenge. Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. HiWATER is an experiment designed to address this challenge through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to obtain multiscale and multidisciplinary data.
challenges: Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations.
methods: Several intensive observation periods (IOPs) and continuous hydrometeorological observations were carried out during HiWATER. Only data collected during the IOP in 2012 are presented in this paper. Instruments for the oasis-desert system were arranged in hierarchically nested scales to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes. We established a sparse network to investigate the oasis-desert interaction. One superstation was constructed within the oasis, and four EC towers and four two-layer automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) were installed in different landscapes surrounding the oasis, including sandy desert, desert pavement, desert steppe, and wetland. Intensive observations were implemented at the irrigation district scale. A total of 12 airborne remote sensing missions were conducted to cover the FEA using LiDAR, an imaging spectrometer, a multi-angle thermal imager, and an L-band microwave radiometer.
dataset: We introduce a multiscale dataset obtained from Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER) in an oasis-desert area in 2012. The HiWATER observation system consists of a flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations; an eco-hydrological sensor network of soil moisture and leaf area index; hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing using LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, and L-band microwave radiometer; and synchronical ground measurements of vegetation dynamics and photosynthesis processes. All observational data were carefully quality controlled throughout sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and datasets generation. The data are freely available at figshare and the Cold and Arid Regions Science Data Centre.
backgroundCn: 生态水文过程在异质表面的上尺度化是一个重大挑战。该领域的进展受到多尺度观测数据稀缺的制约。HiWATER实验旨在通过在分层嵌套尺度上进行仪器布置，以获取多尺度和多学科的数据，从而应对这一挑战。
challengesCn: 该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的阻碍。
methodsCn: 在HiWATER期间进行了几次强烈观测期（IOPs）和连续的水文气象观测。本文仅展示了2012年IOP期间收集的数据。为了捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，绿洲-沙漠系统的仪器按照层次嵌套的尺度进行布置。我们建立了一个稀疏网络，以研究绿洲-沙漠的相互作用。在绿洲内建造了一个超级站，并在绿洲周围不同的景观中安装了四个涡度协方差（EC）塔和四个两层自动气象站（AMS），这些景观包括沙质沙漠、沙漠铺装、沙漠草原和湿地。在灌溉区尺度上实施了强烈观测。共进行了12次空中遥感任务，使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计覆盖了FEA。
datasetCn: 我们介绍了一个多尺度数据集，该数据集来自2012年在绿洲-沙漠地区进行的黑河流域联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER）。HiWATER观测系统由涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站组成的通量观测矩阵；土壤水分和叶面积指数的生态水文传感器网络；使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计的超高分辨率航空遥感；以及同步的植被动态和光合作用过程的地面测量。所有观测数据在传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成过程中都经过了严格的质量控制。这些数据可在figshare和寒区与干旱区科学数据中心免费获取。

Disjunctive.QuestionEn: Is the primary data collection method for vegetation cover in this field based on digital photography, satellite imagery, or ground-based sensors?
Disjunctive.QuestionCn: 在这个领域，植被覆盖的主要数据收集方法是基于数字摄影、卫星影像还是地面传感器？

Disjunctive.QuestionEn: Are the challenges in collecting multiscale observations in this domain more related to instrumentation, data processing, or data availability?
Disjunctive.QuestionCn: 在这个领域，收集多尺度观测的挑战更多是与仪器、数据处理还是数据可用性相关？

Concept Completion.QuestionEn: What methods are used for measuring vegetation coverage in eco-hydrological studies?
Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 在生态水文研究中，测量植被覆盖度的方法有哪些？

Concept Completion.QuestionEn: What instruments are employed in the collection of biomass data, and how is the data processed?
Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 收集生物量数据所使用的仪器有哪些，以及数据是如何处理的？

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of a data collection method used to measure vegetation coverage and biomass in eco-hydrological studies?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个用于测量生态水文研究中植被覆盖和生物量的数据收集方法的示例？
Example.AnswerEn: An example of a data collection method for measuring vegetation coverage and biomass involves using digital cameras to take photos of vegetation within designated plots. These photos are taken from a vertical downward angle using a camera mounted on a support platform. This method is used to calculate vegetation coverage through image analysis, and biomass measurements are taken by weighing selected plant samples for fresh and dry weight calculations.
Example.AnswerCn: 一种测量植被覆盖度和生物量的数据收集方法是使用数码相机拍摄指定样地内的植被照片。这些照片是从垂直向下的角度拍摄的，使用安装在支撑平台上的相机。该方法通过图像分析计算植被覆盖度，并通过称量选定植物样本的鲜重和干重来进行生物量测量。

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of challenges faced in collecting multiscale observations in eco-hydrological research?
Example.QuestionCn: 在生态水文学研究中，收集多尺度观测数据面临的挑战示例包括：
Example.AnswerEn: An example of a challenge in collecting multiscale observations is the poor availability of multiscale data, which hinders progress in understanding eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces. Addressing this challenge involves designing experiments, such as HiWATER, that use hierarchical instrumentation and a sparse network of observation stations to capture data at various scales.
Example.AnswerCn: 收集多尺度观测的一个挑战是多尺度数据的可用性差，这阻碍了对异质表面生态水文过程的理解。解决这一挑战需要设计实验，例如HiWATER，利用分层仪器和稀疏的观测站网络，以捕获不同尺度的数据。

Example.QuestionEn: Could you give an example of a dataset that integrates multiple observational technologies to study eco-hydrological processes?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个整合多种观测技术以研究生态水文过程的数据集示例？
Example.AnswerEn: An example of a dataset integrating multiple observational technologies is the HiWATER dataset, which combines flux observation matrices from eddy covariance towers, automatic meteorological stations, eco-hydrological sensors for soil moisture and leaf area index, hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing, and ground measurements of vegetation dynamics. This multiscale dataset aims to study eco-hydrological processes in an oasis-desert area.
Example.AnswerCn: HiWATER 数据集是一个整合多种观测技术的数据集，它结合了来自涡度协方差塔的通量观测矩阵、自动气象站、用于土壤湿度和叶面积指数的生态水文传感器、高分辨率空中遥感以及植被动态的地面测量。这一多尺度数据集旨在研究绿洲-沙漠地区的生态水文过程。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the specific methods employed for measuring vegetation cover and biomass in eco-hydrological remote sensing experiments?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 在生态水文遥感实验中，测量植被覆盖和生物量的具体方法包括：
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: digital cameras, vertically downward photos, fresh and dry weights, scales, drying ovens
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 数码相机、垂直向下拍摄的照片、新鲜和干燥重量、秤、干燥箱

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What characteristics define the temporal observation frequency in eco-hydrological data collection?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 生态水文数据收集中的时间观察频率的特征包括哪些？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: every 5 days before July 20, every 10 days afterward
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 每5天一次直到7月20日，之后每10天一次。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What attributes of digital image analysis are utilized to calculate vegetation cover in remote sensing studies?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 在遥感研究中，用于计算植被覆盖的数字图像分析的属性包括哪些？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: RGB color space, Lab space, 'a' component histogram, clustering
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: RGB颜色空间，Lab空间，'a'分量直方图，聚类

Quantification.QuestionEn: How many observation sites were involved in the data collection for the vegetation coverage and biomass dataset in the Heihe River Basin?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 在黑河流域的植被覆盖和生物量数据集的数据收集过程中涉及了多少个观测站点？

Quantification.QuestionEn: How frequently were the vegetation coverage data collected at the Superstation before and after July 20th, 2014?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 在2014年7月20日之前和之后，超级站的植被覆盖数据收集频率是多少？

Quantification.QuestionEn: How many types of vegetation were specifically observed for biomass data collection between May and September 2014?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 在2014年5月至9月之间，具体观察到多少种植被用于生物量数据收集？

Definition.QuestionEn: What is meant by 'coverage observation' in the context of eco-hydrological data collection?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在生态水文数据收集的背景下，“覆盖观察”是指对特定区域内生态和水文特征的系统性监测和记录。这通常涉及对植被、水体、土壤和气候等因素的观察，以评估它们之间的相互作用及其对生态系统健康和水资源管理的影响。
Definition.AnswerEn: Coverage observation refers to the method of measuring vegetation coverage using digital photography. In this context, a digital camera is mounted on an instrument platform and controlled remotely to capture images of vegetation from above. These images are used to calculate the percentage of ground covered by vegetation by converting RGB color space to Lab space to distinguish green vegetation from the non-vegetative background.
Definition.AnswerCn: 覆盖观察是指使用数字摄影测量植被覆盖度的方法。在这种情况下，数字相机安装在仪器平台上，并通过远程控制捕捉植被的上方图像。这些图像用于计算被植被覆盖的地面百分比，通过将RGB颜色空间转换为Lab空间，以区分绿色植被和非植被背景。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the methods for measuring vegetation coverage using digital cameras compare to multiscale observations in the HiWATER experiment?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 数字相机测量植被覆盖的方法与HiWATER实验中的多尺度观测相比如何？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The digital camera method involves taking vertical downward photographs to measure vegetation coverage, utilizing an automatic classification method to calculate coverage. In contrast, the HiWATER experiment uses a hierarchical system with flux observation matrices and eco-hydrological sensor networks to capture multiscale processes, integrating various instruments like LiDAR and imaging spectrometers.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 数字相机方法涉及向下垂直拍摄照片以测量植被覆盖率，利用自动分类方法计算覆盖率。相比之下，HiWATER实验采用分层系统，结合通量观测矩阵和生态水文传感器网络，以捕捉多尺度过程，整合了激光雷达和成像光谱仪等多种仪器。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What methodologies could be employed to improve the classification and analysis of vegetation cover data collected through digital photography in eco-hydrological studies?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 可以采用哪些方法来改善通过数字摄影收集的植被覆盖数据在生态水文研究中的分类和分析？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Improving the classification and analysis of vegetation cover data can be achieved by using automated classification methods that convert RGB color space to Lab space, facilitating the separation of green vegetation from non-green backgrounds. This enhances the precision of vegetation cover estimates and supports the development of more advanced, rapid, and accurate classification algorithms.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 通过使用自动分类方法将RGB颜色空间转换为Lab空间，可以改善植被覆盖数据的分类和分析，从而促进绿色植被与非绿色背景的分离。这提高了植被覆盖估计的精确度，并支持开发更先进、快速和准确的分类算法。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the complexity of conducting multiscale eco-hydrological observations in heterogeneous surfaces?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在异质表面进行多尺度生态水文观测的复杂性受哪些因素影响？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The complexity arises from the need to capture eco-hydrological processes across different scales and landscapes, such as oasis-desert interactions, requiring a combination of hierarchically nested instrumentation and a sparse network of observation stations.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 复杂性源于需要在不同尺度和景观中捕捉生态水文过程，例如绿洲-沙漠相互作用，这需要结合分层嵌套的仪器和稀疏的观测站网络。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How does the use of digital cameras for vegetation coverage measurement affect the precision and automation of data collection in eco-hydrological research?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 数字相机在植被覆盖度测量中的使用如何影响生态水文学研究中数据收集的精确性和自动化程度？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: The use of digital cameras enhances precision and automation in data collection by allowing for simple, easy-to-implement methods with high accuracy. The technique involves converting RGB color space to the Lab space to distinguish green vegetation, which simplifies the process and improves the automatic classification of vegetation coverage.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 数字相机的使用通过提供简单、易于实施的方法来增强数据收集的精确性和自动化，且具有高准确性。该技术涉及将RGB颜色空间转换为Lab颜色空间，以区分绿色植被，这简化了过程并改善了植被覆盖的自动分类。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What outcomes might arise from employing a combination of ground-based measurements and remote sensing technologies in eco-hydrological studies?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在生态水文研究中，采用地面测量和遥感技术的组合可能会产生哪些结果？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Employing a combination of ground-based measurements and remote sensing technologies can result in comprehensive datasets that capture multiscale eco-hydrological processes. This integration allows for detailed observations of vegetation dynamics and provides a robust framework for understanding interactions in oasis-desert systems.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 采用地面测量和遥感技术的结合可以产生全面的数据集，捕捉多尺度的生态水文过程。这种整合允许对植被动态进行详细观察，并为理解绿洲-沙漠系统中的相互作用提供了一个强有力的框架。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential implications of using multiscale observations for understanding interactions between oasis and desert landscapes?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 使用多尺度观测来理解绿洲与沙漠景观之间的相互作用的潜在影响是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Multiscale observations can lead to a deeper understanding of oasis-desert interactions by capturing data across hierarchically nested scales. This approach facilitates the examination of eco-hydrological processes, such as vegetation dynamics and water distribution, contributing to a more holistic view of these complex environments.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 多尺度观测可以通过捕捉跨层次嵌套尺度的数据，深入理解绿洲与沙漠之间的相互作用。这种方法有助于研究生态水文过程，如植被动态和水分分布，从而为这些复杂环境提供更全面的视角。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What is the objective of employing digital photography techniques for vegetation coverage observation in eco-hydrological studies?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在生态水文学研究中，采用数字摄影技术观察植被覆盖的目的是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The objective is to utilize digital photography as a measurement tool to capture vegetation coverage data efficiently, enabling targeted measurements for different vegetation types by using an automated classification method for high accuracy and automation.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标是利用数字摄影作为测量工具，高效捕捉植被覆盖数据，通过使用自动分类方法实现对不同植被类型的针对性测量，以达到高准确性和自动化。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the goals behind integrating both ground measurements and airborne remote sensing in eco-hydrological research?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在生态水文研究中，整合地面测量和空中遥感的目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The goal is to obtain comprehensive data that covers both detailed ground-level observations and broader landscape-level insights using remote sensing technologies, facilitating a better understanding of eco-hydrological dynamics over different spatial scales.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标是获取全面的数据，涵盖详细的地面观察和更广泛的景观层面洞察，利用遥感技术，促进对不同空间尺度上生态水文动态的更好理解。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How is biomass measured for different vegetation types in field research?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在野外研究中，不同植被类型的生物量是如何测量的？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: For corn, biomass measurement involves selecting representative plants within sample plots and weighing both fresh and dry biomass after drying at a constant temperature of 85°C. The unit area biomass is calculated considering plant spacing and row spacing. For reeds, biomass is measured by cutting vegetation within a set quadrat, and both fresh and dry weights are measured. The instruments used include a precision balance and an oven for drying.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 对于玉米，生物量测量涉及在样本地块中选择代表性植物，并在85°C的恒定温度下干燥后称量新鲜和干燥生物量。单位面积生物量的计算考虑了植物间距和行间距。对于芦苇，生物量通过在设定的样方内切割植被来测量，并测量新鲜和干燥重量。使用的仪器包括精密天平和用于干燥的烘箱。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What methods are used to ensure the accuracy and reliability of data collected in eco-hydrological experiments?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在生态水文实验中，确保收集数据的准确性和可靠性的方法有哪些？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Data accuracy and reliability are ensured through careful quality control processes, which include sensor calibration, systematic data collection, processing, and dataset generation. The use of multiscale and multidisciplinary instrumentation, such as eddy covariance towers, automatic meteorological stations, and remote sensing technologies, helps in capturing comprehensive and accurate data. Moreover, data is stored systematically in Excel files after initial manual recording, which includes metadata such as planting structure and important agricultural timings for context.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 数据的准确性和可靠性通过严格的质量控制流程得以确保，这些流程包括传感器校准、系统的数据收集、处理和数据集生成。使用多尺度和多学科的仪器，如涡度协方差塔、自动气象站和遥感技术，有助于捕获全面和准确的数据。此外，数据在初步手动记录后系统地存储在Excel文件中，其中包括种植结构和重要农业时间等元数据，以提供背景信息。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What technological advancements have enabled the use of digital cameras for measuring vegetation cover in eco-hydrological studies?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些技术进步使得数字相机能够在生态水文学研究中用于测量植被覆盖？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The use of digital cameras mounted on an instrument platform allows for vertical downward photography, which can be remotely controlled to collect data. Adjusting the camera's shooting height enables targeted measurements for different vegetation types. The data is processed using an automated classification method, converting RGB to Lab color space for easier distinction of green vegetation, which increases automation and precision.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 将数字相机安装在仪器平台上，可以进行垂直向下摄影，并可以远程控制以收集数据。调整相机的拍摄高度可以针对不同的植被类型进行测量。数据通过自动分类方法进行处理，将RGB转换为Lab颜色空间，以便更容易区分绿色植被，从而提高自动化和精确度。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How do hierarchical and nested scales in instrument arrangement enable comprehensive data collection for eco-hydrological processes?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 层次和嵌套尺度在仪器布置中如何促进生态水文过程的全面数据收集？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Hierarchical and nested scales allow for capturing multi-scale eco-hydrological processes by arranging instruments like flux observation matrices and automatic meteorological stations at various scales. This includes sparse networks for oasis-desert interaction studies and intensive observations at the irrigation district level, facilitating detailed data collection across different landscape types.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 层次和嵌套尺度能够通过在不同尺度上布置仪器，如通量观测矩阵和自动气象站，来捕捉多尺度生态水文过程。这包括用于绿洲-沙漠相互作用研究的稀疏网络和在灌溉区级别的密集观测，促进了在不同景观类型中进行详细数据收集。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might the use of digital cameras and remote control for data collection be particularly effective in monitoring vegetation cover in diverse landscapes?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 使用数码相机和遥控设备进行数据收集在监测多样化景观中的植被覆盖方面可能特别有效的原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: The use of digital cameras and remote control allows for targeted and efficient data collection by enabling vertical downward shooting, which captures a comprehensive view of vegetation cover. This method supports the collection of detailed imagery across different vegetation types and terrains, providing high automation and precision in calculating vegetation coverage using advanced classification methods.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 数字相机和遥控设备的使用使得数据收集更加有针对性和高效，能够进行垂直向下拍摄，从而捕捉到全面的植被覆盖视图。这种方法支持在不同植被类型和地形上收集详细的影像，利用先进的分类方法提供高自动化和精确度来计算植被覆盖率。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why could the scarcity of multiscale observations hinder progress in understanding eco-hydrological processes?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 多尺度观测的稀缺性可能会阻碍我们对生态水文过程理解的进展。
Expectation.AnswerEn: Multiscale observations are crucial for capturing the complex interactions within eco-hydrological processes across different scales. Without these observations, it becomes challenging to understand and model these processes comprehensively, especially in heterogeneous surfaces like the oasis-desert systems, which require data from various scales to accurately reflect their dynamics.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 多尺度观测对于捕捉生态水文过程在不同尺度之间的复杂相互作用至关重要。如果没有这些观测，就很难全面理解和建模这些过程，特别是在像绿洲-沙漠系统这样的异质表面上，这需要来自不同尺度的数据以准确反映其动态。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How effective are the data collection methods using digital cameras in capturing accurate vegetation coverage in heterogeneous environments?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 使用数码相机的数据收集方法在捕捉异质环境中的植被覆盖方面的有效性如何？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The data collection methods using digital cameras are effective in capturing vegetation coverage as they utilize a simple, easy-to-implement, and highly automated classification method that converts RGB color space to Lab space to distinguish green vegetation. However, there is a need for more rapid, automated, and accurate classification methods to maximize the advantages of using digital cameras.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 使用数码相机的数据收集方法在捕捉植被覆盖方面是有效的，因为它们利用了一种简单、易于实施且高度自动化的分类方法，将RGB颜色空间转换为Lab空间，以区分绿色植被。然而，需要更快速、自动化和准确的分类方法，以最大化使用数码相机的优势。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: In what ways could the integration of multiscale datasets contribute to better understanding eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert systems?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 多尺度数据集的整合可以通过以下方式促进对绿洲-沙漠系统中生态水文过程的更好理解：
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The integration of multiscale datasets, such as those obtained from flux observation matrices, eco-hydrological sensor networks, and hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing, can contribute to a better understanding of eco-hydrological processes by capturing interactions at different scales. This approach allows for comprehensive monitoring and analysis of vegetation dynamics, soil moisture, and photosynthesis processes, providing a holistic view of the oasis-desert interplay.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 多尺度数据集的整合，例如来自通量观测矩阵、生态水文传感器网络和超高分辨率空中遥感的数据，可以通过捕捉不同尺度的相互作用，帮助更好地理解生态水文过程。这种方法允许对植被动态、土壤湿度和光合作用过程进行全面监测和分析，从而提供对绿洲-沙漠相互作用的整体视角。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how digital cameras can effectively measure vegetation coverage in diverse ecosystems.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白数字相机如何有效地测量多样生态系统中的植被覆盖率。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Digital cameras are used to capture images from directly above the vegetation. These images are then processed using an automatic classification method that converts RGB color space to Lab space, distinguishing green vegetation from non-green backgrounds. This method is simple, automated, and precise for calculating vegetation coverage.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 数字相机用于从植被正上方捕捉图像。这些图像随后使用自动分类方法进行处理，将RGB颜色空间转换为Lab空间，从而区分绿色植被和非绿色背景。这种方法简单、自动化且精确，适用于计算植被覆盖率。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm unsure about the challenges faced in collecting multiscale observational data for eco-hydrological research.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我对在生态水文研究中收集多尺度观测数据所面临的挑战感到不确定。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Collecting multiscale observational data is challenging due to the limited availability of such observations. HiWATER addresses this by using hierarchically nested scales, including superstations and various sensor networks, to capture eco-hydrological processes across different landscapes and scales.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 收集多尺度观测数据具有挑战性，因为此类观测的可用性有限。HiWATER通过使用分层嵌套的尺度，包括超级站和各种传感器网络，来捕捉不同景观和尺度上的生态水文过程。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't make sense of how biomass is accurately measured in field conditions.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解在田间条件下如何准确测量生物量。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Biomass is measured by selecting representative sample plots, harvesting vegetation, and weighing both fresh and dry weight. For corn, the unit area biomass is calculated based on plant spacing, while for reeds, weights are measured from cut samples. This approach ensures accurate representation of biomass in the field.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 生物量通过选择代表性样地、收获植被并称量新鲜重量和干重来测量。对于玉米，单位面积生物量是根据植物间距计算的，而对于芦苇，则是通过切割样本的重量来测量。这种方法确保了对田间生物量的准确代表。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please summarize the methodologies used for observing and calculating vegetation cover and biomass in different ecological stations within a heterogeneous surface.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 总结在不同生态站点观察和计算异质表面植被覆盖和生物量的方法。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The methodologies include using digital cameras for vegetation cover measurement by taking vertical downward photographs with a camera mounted on an observation frame. The observation frame allows adjustment of the camera height based on vegetation type. For biomass measurement, selected sample plots for corn and reed are used, and fresh and dry weights are measured using precision balances and ovens. Coverage calculation is performed using an automatic classification method that converts RGB to Lab color space and separates vegetation from the background based on histogram clustering.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 这些方法包括使用数字相机通过将相机安装在观察框架上进行垂直向下拍摄来测量植被覆盖率。观察框架允许根据植被类型调整相机高度。对于生物量测量，选择了玉米和芦苇的样本 plots，并使用精密天平和烘箱测量新鲜和干重。覆盖率计算采用自动分类方法，将RGB转换为Lab颜色空间，并基于直方图聚类将植被与背景分离。
